title: [Large-scale] Language Learning Program through Application of VR-Based Motivation Design Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental language proficiency and experience with digital devices
context.additional_context: Language learning environment where novices in medical/legal/technical fields virtually experience real-world work scenarios

learning_goals: Learners can identify and explain at least three motivation strategies based on the ARCS model (Attention, Relevance, Confidence, Satisfaction).
Learners demonstrate practical application skills by completing over 80% of profession-linked language tasks in a VR simulation environment.
Learners can design language learning scenarios reflecting motivation design theories through project-based assessments.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
